column4: does anyone know how to reset the sudoers file -- I have added myself to a group and now no sudo and (default) no root passwd....:(...It is a complexed raid setup so I do not want to reinstall if I can help it
have you accidentally removed yourself from the "wheel" group? if you have, just edit /etc/group and put yourself back
no root?
you need to be root to edit that file
aah... right.
fire up a recovery shell
we can give you CLI instructions if you like
Please
allright. are you using the affected computer right now, or are you on another one?
I'm on a good box..the other is next to me
great :) reboot and select the recovery option from grub when it comes up (you may have to hit escape)
it should drop you into a simple root shell
you still there? :)
yes...got a phone call...
k then :) when you are in the root shell, nano /etc/group
in the shell..THANK YOU!
you got it from here? :D
yes, thank you - you saved me hours and tears :)
works now? :D
nice ^_^
for the future though, you may wanna password your grub... you know... easy root access and all? :)
